message_1: If a = 25 and b = 9, simplify the expression √(a/b) .
message_2:
If a = 25 and b = 9, the expression √(a/b) can be simplified as follows:

√(a/b) = √(25/9)

Now, we can simplify the square root of the fraction by taking the square root of the numerator and the square root of the denominator:

√(25/9) = √25 / √9

√25 = 5 (since 5 * 5 = 25)
√9 = 3 (since 3 * 3 = 9)

So, √(25/9) = 5/3.
